references.paper_title: Accelerated filtering on graphs using lanczos method
references.reason: This paper introduces an efficient method for filtering graph signals using the Lanczos method, which is relevant to the proposed method's efficiency in handling large graphs.

references.paper_title: Emergence of scaling in random networks
references.reason: This seminal work introduces the Barabási-Albert model for generating scale-free networks, a common type of network used in the paper's experiments.

references.paper_title: Community structure in social and biological networks
references.reason: This paper introduces the Girvan-Newman algorithm for detecting community structure in networks, which is relevant to the paper's experiments on networks with community structures.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This work introduces Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs), which are widely used in graph-based semi-supervised learning and are relevant to the paper's comparison with GNN-based active learning methods.

references.paper_title: Signal recovery on graphs: Variation minimization
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical foundations for graph signal recovery, which is the core of the proposed active learning method.
